programmes.name: Further Studies Mathematics (formerly Advanced Programme Mathematics)
eligibility: School must be registered to offer Further Studies programmes
Strong mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills
Commitment to additional workload and independent study
benefits: Prepares learners for university-level Mathematics, Engineering, or Sciences (including Actuarial Science)
Develops independent learning, critical thinking, and deeper understanding of complex topics
Recognised internationally as comparable to GCE A-level standard
Provides competitive advantage for STEM university applications
Covers advanced topics like calculus, complex numbers, and mathematical modeling
programmes.aps_boost: Can add 3-4 APS points if taken as an 8th subject

university_recognition.local: Highly valued by SA universities for STEM programs
university_recognition.international: Recognised as A-level equivalent by UK, Australian, and US universities
university_recognition.exemptions: May qualify for first-year mathematics exemptions at some universities

workload.additional_hours: 3-4 hours per week beyond regular Mathematics

notes: Does not replace core Mathematics - taken in addition to regular Mathematics
Requires strong time management and study skills
School must have qualified teachers and IEB registration for Further Studies

programmes.name: Further Studies English (formerly Advanced Programme English)
eligibility: Keen interest in English literature; typically high achievement in Grade 10 English (70%+)
School must be registered to offer Further Studies programmes
Strong reading, writing, and analytical skills
Passion for literature, critical thinking, and cultural studies
benefits: Engages with complex texts, poetry, prose, and films
Develops advanced critical analysis, argumentation, and inter-textual skills
Prepares for university-level study in humanities
Recognised internationally as comparable to GCE A-level standard
Enhances university applications for humanities and social sciences
Develops sophisticated writing and communication skills
programmes.aps_boost: Can add 3-4 APS points if taken as an 8th subject

university_recognition.local: Valued by SA universities for humanities, law, and social science programs
university_recognition.international: Recognised as A-level equivalent for international university applications
university_recognition.exemptions: May qualify for advanced placement in English or humanities courses

workload.additional_hours: 3-4 hours per week beyond regular English
workload.difficulty: University-level literary analysis and critical thinking

notes: Complements regular English Home Language - not a replacement
Requires extensive reading outside of class time
Focuses on critical analysis rather than language mechanics

school_requirements: School must be registered with IEB to offer Further Studies programmes
Qualified teachers with appropriate training required
Adequate resources and library facilities needed
Small class sizes typically maintained for quality instruction
application_process: Students apply through their school in Grade 10
Schools may have internal selection criteria
Early application recommended (usually by Term 3 of Grade 10)
cost_considerations: Additional fees may apply for Further Studies programmes
Textbooks and resources are more expensive
Some schools include in standard fees, others charge separately
